title: Domain 1.1: Identify basic features of Microsoft Windows editions.
content:
🖥️ 1.1 – Windows 10 Editions

🏠 Home

Designed for basic users. Lacks advanced features like Group Policy or BitLocker.

💼 Pro

Adds BitLocker, Remote Desktop host capabilities, and Group Policy management.

🖥️ Pro for Workstations

Optimized for high-end hardware. Supports ReFS file system, more RAM, and persistent memory.

🏢 Enterprise

Built for large organizations. Includes AppLocker, Windows To Go, and advanced security features.

🔄 In-Place Upgrade

Upgrades Windows to a newer edition/version without deleting files or apps. Smooth transition for users.

⚙️ Feature Differences

  • Domain vs. Workgroup:
    • Domain: Used in business environments with centralized control via Active Directory.
    • Workgroup: Peer-to-peer, used in home networks.
  • Desktop/User Interface: Higher editions may allow more Start Menu or Taskbar customization.
  • Remote Desktop: Only Pro and above can host RDP sessions. Home edition can only connect.
  • RAM Support:
    • Home: Up to 128 GB
    • Enterprise/Pro for Workstations: Up to 2 TB+
  • BitLocker: Full disk encryption. Available only in Pro, Enterprise, and Education.
  • Group Policy Editor (gpedit.msc): Not available in Home edition. Used to manage system settings in Pro and higher.
